description: Energy monitoring dashboard comparing Kepler Reboot, Node Exporter, and Kepler metrics for system-wide, process-level, and container-level energy consumption analysis.

panels.description: Overall dashboard explanation and information about the metrics being collected

options.content:
## 🔋 Energy Monitoring Dashboard

This dashboard provides comparative metrics from multiple energy monitoring solutions:

| Source | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| **🚀 Kepler Reboot** | Next generation energy monitoring with enhanced precision |
| **🔥 Node Exporter** | Hardware-level monitoring via Prometheus node exporter |
| **⚡ Kepler** | Kubernetes-based energy monitoring for containerized workloads |

Use the dashboard variables to select:
- RAPL zone (package, core, dram)
- Monitoring job
- Process to analyze

panels.description: CPU information from the Kepler Reboot monitoring tool
panels.title: CPU Information

panels.title: Current Energy Consumption Values

panels.description: Difference between Node exporter and Kepler Reboot energy measurements in joules. Values close to zero indicate good alignment between the metrics.
panels.title: Node Exporter vs Kepler Reboot Measurement Delta (Joules)

panels.description: Difference between Node exporter and Kepler Reboot energy measurements in watts. Values close to zero indicate good alignment between the metrics.
panels.title: Node Exporter vs Kepler Reboot Measurement Delta (Watts)

panels.description: Direct comparison of energy measurements from all three monitoring systems - Node Exporter, Kepler Reboot, and Kepler.
panels.title: Node Energy Measurement Comparison

panels.description: Process-level energy monitoring with selected PID: ${pid} (${process})

options.content:
## 📊 Process Energy Monitoring

Comparing process-level metrics between Kepler Reboot and Kepler for the selected process.

Key metrics shown:
- Attribution gap between node and process measurements
- Direct power consumption comparisons between monitoring systems
- Joules and Watts measurements from different sources

panels.description: Energy difference between node-level and process-level measurements
panels.title: Process Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Difference between node-level and process-level energy over time
panels.title: Node-Process Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Energy consumption comparison for selected process (${process})
panels.title: Process Energy Comparison - ${process}

options.content:
## 📊 Container Energy Monitoring

This section shows container-level energy metrics from Kepler Reboot and Kepler.

Metrics shown:
- Energy attribution gap between process and container measurements
- Power consumption comparisons across monitoring systems
- Container power attribution accuracy

panels.description: Energy difference between process-level and container-level measurements
panels.title: Container Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Difference between process-level and container-level energy over time
panels.title: Process-Container Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Percentage of energy measured at node level that is not attributed to specific processes
panels.title: Kepler Reboot - Process Energy Attribution Gap (%)

panels.description: Percentage of energy measured at node level that is not attributed to specific processes
panels.title: Kepler - Process Energy Attribution Gap (%)
